ch4forecast.model package¶

Submodules¶

ch4forecast.model.attention module¶

Author: Boyang Hu GitHub Username: edsml-bh223

Description:

Implementions of different attention mechanisms.

class ch4forecast.model.attention.CBAM(channels, reduction_ratio=16, spatial=True)¶

Bases: Module

Convolutional Block Attention Module (CBAM).

Parameters:

  • channels (int) -- The number of input channels.

  • reduction_ratio (int, optional) -- The reduction ratio for the channel attention. Default is 16.

  • spatial (bool, optional) -- Whether to include spatial attention. Default is True.

channel_attn¶

Channel attention module.

Type:

ChannelAttention

spatial_attn¶

Spatial attention module, if spatial is True; otherwise, None.

Type:

SpatialAttention or None

References

[1]

https://github.com/Jongchan/attention-module/tree/5d3a54af0f6688bedca3f179593dff8da63e8274

class ch4forecast.model.attention.ChannelAttention(channels, reduction_ratio=16)¶

Bases: Module

Channel Attention module.

Parameters:

  • channels (int) -- The number of input channels.

  • reduction_ratio (int, optional) -- The reduction ratio for the MLP. Default is 16.

mlp¶

Multilayer perceptron consisting of Flatten, Linear, ReLU, and Linear layers.

Type:

torch.nn.Sequential

class ch4forecast.model.attention.SpatialAttention(kernel_size=7)¶

Bases: Module

Spatial Attention module.

Parameters:

kernel_size (int, optional) -- The size of the convolutional kernel. Default is 7.

conv1¶

Convolution layer with specified kernel size and padding.

Type:

torch.nn.Conv2d

activate¶

Sigmoid activation function.

Type:

torch.nn.Sigmoid

class ch4forecast.model.attention.TemporalAttention(input_dim, hidden_dim, out_dim)¶

Bases: Module

Self-attention module along the time dimension.

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int) -- The number of input channels.

  • hidden_dim (int) -- The number of hidden channels for the query and key convolutions.

  • out_dim (int) -- The number of output channels for the value convolution.

query¶

Convolutional layer for computing the query.

Type:

torch.nn.Conv2d

key¶

Convolutional layer for computing the key.

Type:

torch.nn.Conv2d

value¶

Convolutional layer for computing the value.

Type:

torch.nn.Conv2d

softmax¶

Softmax layer for computing attention weights.

Type:

torch.nn.Softmax

References

[1]

https://chatgpt.com/share/2233ba10-c2d1-4b06-9e83-41354cbfc1fe

__call__
forward(x)¶

Forward pass for the Temporal Attention module.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) -- Input tensor with shape [B, T, C, H, W], where B is the batch size, T is the number of time steps, C is the number of channels, and H and W are the height and width of the feature maps.

Returns:

Output tensor with the same shape as input [B, T, out_dim, H, W].

Return type:

torch.Tensor

Description:

Functions of training, testing, predicting models.

forward(x)¶

Forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) -- Input tensor of shape [B, t, C, H, W].

Returns:

Output tensor of shape [B, t, 1, H, W], where the last time step is repeated for all future time steps.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

class ch4forecast.model.buildmodel.BuildModel(args)¶

Bases: object

A class to build and configure different forecasting models based on provided arguments.

This class initializes various forecasting models such as TALSTMNet and CALSTMNet, provides functions for training, testing, predicting.

Parameters:

args (Namespace) --

Arguments for model configuration, including: - model (str): The type of model to build:

  • 'ConvLSTM': model without any attention

  • 'CALSTM': model with channel attention

  • 'SALSTM': model with spatial attention

  • 'CSLSTM': model with both spatial and channel attention (CBAM)

  • 'TALSTM': model with temporal attention

  • 'CSTALSTM': model with both CBAM and temporal attention

  • name (str): name of files to be saved.

  • input_dim (int): The number of input channels.

  • hidden_dim (list of int): The number of hidden units for each layer.

  • kernel_size (list of tuple): The kernel sizes for each layer.

  • num_layers (int): The number of layers in the model.

  • output_dim (int): The number of output channels.

  • device (str): The device to use ('cpu' or 'cuda').

  • pretrained (str): Path to a pre-trained model state dictionary (optional).

  • val_rio (float): Ratio for splitting the dataset into training and validation sets (if applicable).

  • batch_size (int): The batch size for data loading.

  • num_workers (int): Number of workers for data loading.

model¶

The initialized model based on the specified type.

Type:

nn.Module

device¶

The device on which the model will be placed ('cpu' or 'cuda').

Type:

torch.device or str

gradscaler¶

The gradient scaler used for mixed precision training.

Type:

GradScaler

evalkeys¶

Keys for evaluation metrics.

Type:

list of str

Methods

compute_resource(data)

Compute and print resource usage for the model.

predict(data, timeindex, days)

Generate predictions for a specified number of days starting from given time indices.

test_roll(data)

Evaluate the model's performance by rolling predictions over multiple days.

train(trainloader, valloader)

Train the model over multiple epochs and validate.

train_epoch(data, optimizer, criterion)

Perform a single training epoch.

validate_epoch(data, criterion)

Perform a single validation epoch.
compute_resource(data)¶

Compute and print resource usage for the model.

Parameters:

  • data (tuple) -- A tuple containing input and target tensors used for computing resource usage.

  • Prints

  • -------

  • RAM). (Trainable parameters count and memory usage (CUDA and)

References

[1]

https://chatgpt.com/share/6059226b-612e-4d55-8c69-e94c7159c488

predict(data, timeindex: int | list, days: int)¶

Generate predictions for a specified number of days starting from given time indices.

Save the predictions. The saved path is controlled by args.output_path and args.name.

Parameters:

  • data (nn.utils.data.dataset) -- Dataset providing input and target data for prediction.

  • timeindex (int or list) -- Number of random time indices to sample or specific list of time indices for predictions.

  • days (int) -- Number of days to predict.

Returns:

predictions -- Array of predicted values for the specified number of days and time indices.

Return type:

np.ndarray

test_roll(data)¶

Evaluate the model's performance by rolling predictions over multiple days.

Save the test results. The saved path is controlled by args.output_path and args.name.

Parameters:

data (nn.utils.data.dataset) -- Dataset providing input and target data for testing.

Returns:

err -- Array of evaluation metrics averaged over all test samples and days.

Return type:

np.ndarray

train(trainloader, valloader)¶

Train the model over multiple epochs and validate.

Save the training logs and model checkpoints. The saved path is controlled by args.output_path and args.name.

Parameters:

  • trainloader (DataLoader) -- DataLoader providing batches of input and target data for training.

  • valloader (DataLoader) -- DataLoader providing batches of input and target data for validation.

train_epoch(data, optimizer, criterion)¶

Perform a single training epoch.

Parameters:

  • data (DataLoader) -- DataLoader providing batches of input and target data for training.

  • optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer) -- Optimizer used for updating model parameters.

  • criterion (nn.Module) -- Loss function used to compute the training loss.

Returns:

  • train_loss (float) -- Average training loss for the epoch.

  • train_err (np.ndarray) -- Array of evaluation metrics (mae, mse, rmse, mape, r2) for the training data.

validate_epoch(data, criterion)¶

Perform a single validation epoch.

Parameters:

  • data (DataLoader) -- DataLoader providing batches of input and target data for validation.

  • criterion (nn.Module) -- Loss function used to compute the validation loss.

Returns:

  • val_loss (float) -- Average validation loss for the epoch.

  • val_err (np.ndarray) -- Array of evaluation metrics (mae, mse, rmse, mape, r2) for the validation data.

ch4forecast.model.buildmodel.error_metrics(y_true, y_pred)¶

Calculate error metrics for model evaluation.

Parameters:

  • y_true (array-like) -- The ground truth target values.

  • y_pred (array-like) -- The predicted values by the model.

Returns:

An array containing the following metrics: - Mean Absolute Error (MAE) - Mean Squared Error (MSE) - Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) - Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) - R-squared (R2) Score

Return type:

np.array

ch4forecast.model.buildmodel.set_seed(seed)¶

Use this to set ALL the random seeds to a fixed value and take out any randomness from cuda kernels

ch4forecast.model.convLSTM module¶

Author: Boyang Hu GitHub Username: edsml-bh223

Description:

Implementions of ConvLSTM backbone.

class ch4forecast.model.convLSTM.CALSTMNet(input_dim, hidden_dim, kernel_size, num_layers, output_dim, attention)¶

Bases: Module

Attention-based convolutional LSTM Network.

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int) -- The number of input channels for the ConvLSTM.

  • hidden_dim (int or list of int) -- The number of hidden channels for each ConvLSTM layer.

  • kernel_size (tuple of int or list of tuple of int) -- The size of the convolutional kernel for each ConvLSTM layer.

  • num_layers (int) -- The number of ConvLSTM layers.

  • output_dim (int) -- The number of output channels.

  • attention (str, optional) -- Type of attention mechanism to use in ConvLSTM. Options are "CS" (Channel and Spatial Attention), "SA" (Spatial Attention), "CA" (Channel Attention), or None for no attention.

lstm¶

Convolutional LSTM module for sequence processing.

Type:

ConvLSTM

conv¶

Convolutional layer for generating the final output.

Type:

torch.nn.Conv2d

class ch4forecast.model.convLSTM.ConvLSTM(input_dim, hidden_dim, kernel_size, num_layers, batch_first=True, bias=True, attention=None, return_all_layer=False)¶

Bases: Module

Convolutional LSTM network consisting of multiple ConvLSTMCells.

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int) -- The number of input channels.

  • hidden_dim (int or list of int) -- The number of hidden channels for each layer.

  • kernel_size (tuple of int or list of tuple of int) -- The size of the convolutional kernel for each layer.

  • num_layers (int) -- The number of ConvLSTM layers.

  • batch_first (bool, optional) -- If True, the input and output tensors are provided as [B, time, C, H, W]. Otherwise, the shape should be [time, B, C, H, W]. Default is True.

  • bias (bool, optional) -- If True, adds a learnable bias to the output. Default is True.

  • attention (str, optional) -- Type of attention mechanism to use. Options are "CS" (Channel and Spatial Attention), "SA" (Spatial Attention), "CA" (Channel Attention), or None for no attention. Default is None.

  • return_all_layer (bool, optional) -- If True, return the output and states of all layers. Otherwise, return only the last layer. Default is False.

num_layers¶

The number of ConvLSTM layers.

Type:

int

batch_first¶

If True, the input and output tensors are provided as [B, time, C, H, W].

Type:

bool

return_all_layer¶

If True, return the output and states of all layers.

Type:

bool

cell_list¶

List containing ConvLSTMCell modules.

Type:

torch.nn.ModuleList

References

[1]

https://github.com/ndrplz/ConvLSTM_pytorch/tree/master

__call__
_check_consistency(hidden_dim, kernel_size, num_layers)¶

Check and ensure consistency of hidden_dim and kernel_size.

Parameters:

  • hidden_dim (int, list of int, or tuple of int) -- The number of hidden channels.

  • kernel_size (tuple of int, list of tuple of int) -- The size of the convolutional kernel.

  • num_layers (int) -- The number of layers.

Returns:

  • hidden_dim: list of int

    The number of hidden channels for each layer.

  • kernel_size: list of tuple of int

    The size of the convolutional kernel for each layer.

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

ValueError -- If hidden_dim or kernel_size are not of expected types or lengths.

_init_hidden(batch_size, field_size)¶

Initialize the hidden and cell states.

Parameters:

  • batch_size (int) -- The batch size.

  • field_size (tuple of int) -- The height and width of the hidden states.

Returns:

Initialized hidden and cell states for each layer.

Return type:

list of tuple of torch.Tensor

forward(input_tensor, hidden_state=None)¶

Forward pass for the ConvLSTM network.

Parameters:

  • input_tensor (torch.Tensor) -- Input tensor with shape [B, time, C, H, W] or [time, B, C, H, W].

  • hidden_state (list of tuple of torch.Tensor, optional) -- Initial hidden and cell states for each layer. If not provided, they are initialized to zeros.

Returns:

  • layer_output_list: list of torch.Tensor

    List of output tensors for each layer, each with shape [B, time, hidden_dim, H, W].

  • last_state_list: list of tuple of torch.Tensor

    List of the last hidden and cell states for each layer, each with shape [B, hidden_dim, H, W].

Return type:

tuple

class ch4forecast.model.convLSTM.ConvLSTMCell(input_dim, hidden_dim, kernel_size, bias, attention=None)¶

Bases: Module

Convolutional LSTM Cell with optional attention mechanism.

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int) -- The number of input channels.

  • hidden_dim (int) -- The number of hidden channels.

  • kernel_size (tuple of int) -- The size of the convolutional kernel.

  • bias (bool) -- If True, adds a learnable bias to the output.

  • attention (str, optional) -- Type of attention mechanism to use. Options are "CS" (Channel and Spatial Attention), "SA" (Spatial Attention), "CA" (Channel Attention), or None for no attention. Default is None.

hidden_dim¶

The number of hidden channels.

Type:

int

conv¶

Convolutional layer for computing the gates.

Type:

torch.nn.Conv2d

ci¶

Parameter for input gate.

Type:

torch.nn.Parameter

cf¶

Parameter for forget gate.

Type:

torch.nn.Parameter

co¶

Parameter for output gate.

Type:

torch.nn.Parameter

attention¶

Attention module if specified, otherwise None.

Type:

torch.nn.Module or None

References

[1]

https://github.com/ndrplz/ConvLSTM_pytorch/tree/master

class ch4forecast.model.convLSTM.TALSTMNet(input_dim, hidden_dim, kernel_size, num_layers, output_dim, attention)¶

Bases: Module

Multiple attention-based convolutional LSTM Network.

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int) -- The number of input channels for the ConvLSTM.

  • hidden_dim (int or list of int) -- The number of hidden channels for each ConvLSTM layer.

  • kernel_size (tuple of int or list of tuple of int) -- The size of the convolutional kernel for each ConvLSTM layer.

  • num_layers (int) -- The number of ConvLSTM layers.

  • output_dim (int) -- The number of output channels.

  • attention (str, optional) -- Type of attention mechanism to use in ConvLSTM. Options are "CS" (Channel and Spatial Attention), "SA" (Spatial Attention), "CA" (Channel Attention), or None for no attention. Default is None.

lstm¶

Convolutional LSTM module for sequence processing.

Type:

ConvLSTM

att_layer¶

Self-attention layer (along the time dimension) for enhancing time dependencies.

Type:

TemporalAttention
